I The risk faced by a firm can be divided into two sources. some of the risk is specific to the firm, and is called firm-specific. the rest of the risk is market wide and affects all investments.

extracted_sections.section_title: to macroeconomic factors that affect the overall market.
extracted_sections.refined_text: the beta value for a firm depends on the sensitivity of the demand for its products and services and of its costs to macroeconomic factors that affect the overall market. firms which sell more discretionary products will have higher betas than non-cyclical firms.

the limit of diversification is to hold a portfolio of every single asset in the economy. this portfolio is called the market portfolio. I Individual investors will adjust for risk, by adjusting their allocations to this market portfolio and a riskless asset (such as a T-Bill)
